sentences.en: a hot dog with mustard and relish
sentences.cn: 配芥末酱和调味汁的热狗

sentences.en: And we're bringing the ketchup, mustard, relish all that stuff.
sentences.cn: 我们还要带蕃茄酱, 芥末, 调味酱,诸如此类的东西.

sentences.en: Hearn pulled off another piece of turkey and ate it with relish.
sentences.cn: 候恩,又撕下一片火鸡肉,吃得津津有味.

sentences.en: Hilary won't relish having to wash all those dishes.
sentences.cn: 希拉里是不会愿意洗所有那些盘子的.

sentences.en: I do not relish my food as I used to.
sentences.cn: 我现在不像以前那样爱吃了.

sentences.en: I have no relish for pop music.
sentences.cn: 我对流行音乐不感兴趣.

sentences.en: I relish the challenge of doing jobs that others turn down.
sentences.cn: 我喜欢挑战别人拒绝做的工作。

sentences.en: I would relish a lobster and a bottle of wine.
I, indeed, talked comparatively little, but I heard him talk with relish.
sentences.cn: 我固然谈得比较少, 可是我兴致勃勃地听他谈.

sentences.en: Routine office jobs have no relish at all for me.
sentences.cn: 我对坐办公室那种刻板的工作毫无兴趣.

sentences.en: She folded up her letter, licking the envelope flap with relish.
sentences.cn: 她把信折好，用力舔了舔信封的折口。

sentences.en: She won't relish having to get up before dawn to catch that train.
sentences.cn: 她不喜欢黎明前起床赶那班火车.

sentences.en: Spices give relish to a dish.
The cheerfulness of the children added a relish to his existence.
sentences.cn: 孩子们给他的欢娱,更使他加添了生活的乐趣.

sentences.en: The three men ate with relish.
Unavoidable things which, while she didn't relish them, had to be endured.
sentences.cn: 她认为这是无可避免的事, 虽然自己不见得就愿意它来, 但是来了也只好忍受.

words.tran_cn: 滋味；风味；食欲；开胃小菜；含义

trans.tran_cn: 味道，滋味，调味品，引起兴趣的东西

trans.tran_en: to enjoy an experience or the thought of something that is going to happen

trans.tran_cn: 品尝，品味，给…加佐料，调味，欣赏
trans.tran_en: to enjoy an experience or the thought of something that is going to happen
